intro: Sebaea confertiflora, commonly known as the thick-flowered sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Sebaea confertiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and compact growth habit.
